detaileddescription.para: The number of bits of precision required for integer centroid calculation and overflows.
Mantissa size of the integer parameter values (higher by 1 bit in practice for real value 1.0). Accounts for a sign bit, and possible accumulation overflows.
Mantissa
Negative
Mask that

briefdescription.para: The total number of internal parameter values in use.
The size of population in use (maximal).
update. This variable should be initialized by the optimizer.

detaileddescription.para: Current population position, for initial population

briefdescription.para: The number of constraints per solution.
The number of objectives per solution.

detaileddescription.para: Population parameter vectors. Always kept sorted in ascending cost order. Each vector represents a complex item, with additional data stored after parameter values (see Offs constants).
Byte offset to the constraint values within
Byte offset to the objective values within a
Byte offset to the rank value within a population

briefdescription.para: Size in bytes of population item.

detaileddescription.para: Temporary parameter vector, points to the last

memberdef.argsstring: (const int aParamCount, const int aPopSize, const int aCnsCount=0, const int aObjCount=1)
memberdef.name: initBuffers

detaileddescription.para: Function initializes all common buffers, and "PopSize" variables. This function should be called when population's dimensions were changed. This function calls the deleteBuffers() function to release any derived classes' allocated buffers. Allocates an additional vector for temporary use, which is at the same the last vector in the PopParams array. Derived classes should call this function of the base class.

parameterdescription.para: New population size. If <= 0, population buffers will not be allocated.
New objective value count. If equals 0, a rank element will not be auto-added.

detaileddescription.para: Function copies population from the specified source population. If *this population has a different size, or is uninitialized, it will be initialized to source's population size.

parameterdescription.para: Source population to copy. Should be initalized.

detaileddescription.para: Function recalculates centroid based on the current population size. The NeedCentUpdate variable can be checked if centroid update is needed. This function resets the NeedCentUpdate to "false". This function should only be called after the population is filled.
Function returns pointer to the centroid vector. The NeedUpdateCent should be checked and and if it is equal to "true", the updateCentroid() function called.
Function returns population's parameter vector by the specified index from the ordered list.
Function returns pointer to constraint values sub-array within the specified population vector.
Function returns pointer to objective values sub-array within the specified population vector.
Function returns pointer to the rank value sub-array within the specified population vector.
Function returns a pointer to array of population vector pointers, which are sorted in the ascending cost order.
Function returns pointer to the next available parameter vector, at the initialization stage. When the population was filled, the function returns pointer to a temporary vector.
Function returns current population size.
Function returns current population position.

Function resets the current population position to zero, and sets CurPopSize to PopSize. This function is usually called when the population needs to be completely changed. This function should be called before any updates to *this population (usually during optimizer's initialization).
Function increases current population size, and updates the required variables. This function can only be called if CurPopSize is less than PopSize, and previously the whole population was filled.
Function decreases current population size, and updates the required variables. This function can only be called if CurPopSize is greater than 1, and the whole population was filled.

memberdef.argsstring: (double UpdCost, const ptype *const UpdParams, const bool DoUpdateCentroid, const bool CanRejectCost=true)
memberdef.name: updatePop

detaileddescription.para: Function replaces the highest-cost previous solution, updates centroid. This function considers the value of the CurPopPos variable - if it is smaller than the PopSize, the new solution will be added to population without any checks.

parameterdescription.para: "True" if centroid should be updated using running sum. This update is done for parallel populations.
If "true", solution with a duplicate cost will be rejected; this may provide a performance improvement. Solutions can only be rejected when the whole population was filled.

simplesect.para: Insertion position, ">=CurPopSize" if the cost constraint was not met.

detaileddescription.para: Function deletes buffers previously allocated via the initBuffers() function. Derived classes should call this function of the base class.
An aux function that resets a parameter vector to zero values.
An aux function that copies a parameter vector.
An aux function that copies a real solution vector.

Function wraps the specified parameter value so that it stays in the [0.0; 1.0] range (including in integer range), by wrapping it over the boundaries using random operator. This operation improves convergence in comparison to clamping.

memberdef.argsstring: (CBiteRnd &rnd, const double sd, const ptype meanInt)
memberdef.name: getGaussianInt

detaileddescription.para: Function generates a Gaussian-distributed pseudo-random number, in integer scale, with the specified mean and std.dev.
Function calculates averaging coefficient of a "leaky integrator" 1st order low-pass filter.

parameterdescription.para: An approximate number of samples to average.

detaileddescription.para: Class implements storage of population parameter vectors, costs, centroid, and ordering. Note that the derived classes should delete allocated buffers in their destructors, not relying on a single deleteBuffers() call.
